metadata.title: CVE-2022-46342 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This security flaw occurs because thehandler for the XvdiSelectVideoNotify request may write to memory after ithas been freed. This issue can lead to local privileges elevation onsystems where the X se

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46342` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xdmx-tools - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xnest - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xorg-server-source - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xserver-common - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xvfb - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
xwayland - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.5').
